questions.subject: Mathematics Advanced
questions.text: Find the exact value of the integral of (2x) / (x^2 + 1) dx from 0 to 2.

questions.subject: Mathematics Extension 1
questions.text: A projectile is fired from the origin with velocity 20 m/s at an angle of 60° to the horizontal. The position of the projectile at time t is given by x = 10t and y = 10√3t - 4.9t^2. Find the Cartesian equation for the path of the projectile.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.text: A spaceship is measured to be 80 m long when at rest. It then travels at a speed of 0.6c. Calculate the length of the spaceship as measured by a stationary observer.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.text: A proton (q = 1.602 x 10^-19 C, m = 1.672 x 10^-27 kg) enters a uniform magnetic field of 0.5 T at a speed of 2.0 x 10^6 m/s, perpendicular to the field. Calculate the radius of its circular path.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.text: Calculate the mass of carbon dioxide (CO₂) produced when 12.0 g of carbon is burnt in excess oxygen. (Molar mass: C=12.01 g/mol, O=16.00 g/mol).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.text: Consider the equilibrium: 2NO₂(g) ⇌ N₂O₄(g), where ΔH = -57 kJ/mol. The mixture is brown due to NO₂. If the temperature of the sealed container is decreased, what will be observed and why?
questions.answer: The mixture will become lighter/less brown because the forward reaction is exothermic, so decreasing temperature shifts the equilibrium to the right to produce more heat.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.text: A student titrates 25.00 mL of a 0.105 M solution of acetic acid (CH₃COOH, Ka = 1.8 x 10^-5) with a 0.115 M solution of sodium hydroxide (NaOH). Calculate the pH at the equivalence point.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.text: A 250 g block of aluminium at 95°C is placed into 500 g of water at 20°C in an insulated container. Calculate the final equilibrium temperature. (Specific heat of Al = 900 J/kg/°C, Specific heat of water = 4186 J/kg/°C).
